channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: 10 New Netflix Shows to Start Watching In October
item.dc:creator: T.M. Amrita
item.description: Tune into the newest releases of the month.
item.content:encoded: Is your Netflix watch list looking a little dry after the September high of new releases? With the new month comes newer, exciting titles, as Netflix has lined up a string of new releases for October.

item.title: These 10 Lovecraftian Horror Movies Are My Trippy Jam
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: These are the cosmic horror films to add some unorthodox frights to your spooky movie playlist.
item.content:encoded: There are many horror sub-genres, but cosmic horror is one of the most fascinating. Mixing in science fiction and monster elements, the terror from the skies can take many forms. Sometimes a strange force threatens our realm, and other times we stumble upon it when venturing across the stars.

item.title: Is Your PC Using Too Much Power? Cut It Back With These Tips
item.dc:creator: Timothy Jacob Hudson
item.description: If your PC is guzzling too much electricity, these tips will help you cut back on its power draw.
item.content:encoded: Whether you're building your own PC or just trying to save as many cents as possible on your power bill each month, there are many areas in which your computer may be unnecessarily drawing power. Follow these tips, and you can tone that power draw back as much as possible.

item.title: 4 Things I Miss After Switching From Samsung to a Google Pixel
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: The grass isn't greener on the Pixel 10 Pro.
item.content:encoded: Samsung makes incredible phones I've enjoyed for years, but I recently switched from my Samsung Galaxy S25+ to the Google Pixel 10 Pro XL. And while I'm currently loving this phone and being on team Pixel, there are several aspects I miss about my Samsung Galaxy and One UI.

item.title: This $15 Gadget Transformed My Desk Setup
item.dc:creator: Ismar Hrnjicevic
item.description: Who knew something this cheap could do so much?
item.content:encoded: Desktop upgrades are usually either expensive, underwhelming, or both. It’s easy to spend a fortune on some piece of equipment, only to realize later that it’s completely useless. However, with this particular gadget, the opposite is true—it’s both cheap and incredibly effective.

item.title: How to Exit the Vi or Vim Editor
item.dc:creator: Dave McKay
item.description: We'll show you how to make a graceful exit, rather than just unplugging your PC.
item.content:encoded: The vi editor is confusing if you're not used to it. It takes a secret handshake to escape this application if you've stumbled into it. Here's how to quit vi or vim on Linux, macOS, or any other Unix-like system.

item.title: Not All Movie Remakes Are Bad—These Are The Ones I Love
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: These are the remakes that’ll make you see the light on how great these types of films can be.
item.content:encoded: Remakes tend to get a bad rap for being seen as lazy and/or safe retreads of the familiar. If you’ve already seen a story, what’s the point of seeing it again with different forces trying to make the same movie? While plenty of remakes undoubtedly fit that description, there are just as many that offer a refreshing revision instead of a reprisal.

item.title: Windows 11's Big Update, Google and Amazon's New Speakers, The Debian Pi Upgrade, and More: News Roundup
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description: Everything you might have missed from the last week.
item.content:encoded: This was another busy week in tech, with Google and Amazon revealing new smart home devices, the arrival of Windows 11 25H2, a big update for Raspberry Pi computers, and much more. Here are the biggest stories you might have missed.

item.title: 3 TV Shows That Teach You New Hobbies and Skills
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: These are my favorite shows that taught me something new, with valuable skills worth learning.
item.content:encoded: Sometimes you want to get more out of streaming television than an enthralling story and a mindless time-waster of game shows and reality competition. Sometimes you want to learn something to understand the world better. We have a wealth of media at our fingertips, and we should be getting more out of it besides a few gasps and laughs.

item.title: 9 Practical Ways to Use the Linux seq Command
item.dc:creator: Haroon Javed
item.content:encoded: The seq command is far more than a simple number printer. It's a fundamental building block you can use for creating test files, controlling loops, performing network scans, and running mathematical calculations. Here are some common ways to use the seq command.
